title: Ekko should never be buffed
body:
This champion literally stays in lane spamming his Q at no cost. The moment you try to do something about his passive and uninteractive gameplay, he clicks R to run away and TPs back to lane to continue his Q spam. Why this champion is even in the game blows my mind. High mobility, high damage, EXTREMELY safe, wave clear and the list goes on. 

I'd rather face {{champion:51}} than {{champion:245}} any day of the week.

replies.body: you know you have a champion too its not like you cant do anything

What are you talking about, he just opens mid the instant he sees ekko in the game.
/s

While I will 100% agree that Ekko doesn't need any buffs are you serious? Ekko is annoying early to mid game but it is easy to CC him through his ulty. Meanwhile Caitlyn hids behind her frontline headshot critting for 1500 xD. I would much rather deal with a fed Ekko then caitlyn. Atleast I don't feel like anti siege/sieging is impossible against Ekko lol.
How are you going to CC Ekko when he ults? He becomes untargetable.
Watch his clone and predict it.
??? How does that help. His R can't be cancelled. He'll TP and heal/deal damage anyways.

When he ults, he goes to his clone, you can just meet him there. Can't count the times I just wait for an Ekko to ult out of a fight and I just wham him. It's pretty straightforward when you keep calm in the team fight.
You're missing a point here completely...

What point did I miss?

Unless he activated his W you just watch his clone and when he teleports to it, just unload on him as he arrives. If you are too close to him, yeah you'll take damage and he'll heal, but that is remedied by spreading out and not fighting near his clone.

Like I said before, in team fights, whenever I am against an Ekko, I'm focusing on my team but also keeping tabs on the clone. Nothing to it.

So a teamfight for you looks only like that: 1v5 ekko and you all stand there and watch him ulting to kill him. 
He never has a team, you never lost a few members, he just stands there and waits for you to kill him, he has no abilities or items. 
Strange teamfights against an ekko you have.

A team fight is me focusing down the heavy damage dealers. For me, Ekko is a heavy damage dealer. I let my front line engage, I'm watching for the ADC and all that other nonsense, but Ekko's clone can very well change the outcome of a fight. If I'm always watching it and he ults, I know exactly where he'll be and me (and hopefully my team if they all did not focus incorrectly) can converge and land a kill and take out a heavy damage dealer.

I think the guy is trying to say that Ekko is an early game assassin who, because he's an assassin, does lots of damage. He also has a low cooldown on his waveclear ability. And if you catch him out with CC, skill, whatever, he'll ult straight out of it. Late game, yeah, you can get him after the ult in a teamfight. But the fact that Ekko can even have his teamfight is kind of unfair considering how safe his aggression is in the early game.

I understand Ekko's high damage, but people should understand that this damage is quite slow and takes quite alot of time.

In terms of his CD, 9s is *not* low. If you catch him in CC, he's dead unless you don't have the burst. He is horrid against people like Zed or Diana or Talon, or any mages that can snare and straight up one shot burst his entire being. If you are playing someone like Brand expecting to kill him 1v1, then of course he gets the opportunity to escape.

Also, his aggression early is not safe at all. If you take TP and push the wave (which you should), I can say his aggression levels 1 and 2 are safe, because he can just go back, get some more mana, and be ok until he needs to back again. However, in both cases (whether he takes ignite or tp) if he focuses ONLY on the wave, he cannot really spend time trading. Using Q so much takes alot of mana, and if he uses his E and W in a trade that he did not start, he is already in a bind. I already said this before, but people who out sustain him or can harass him heavily (Vlad, Ori, Cass, etc.) make his laning a bit more complicated than simply pressing Q to win like how most people here think.

His laning isn't safe at all unless he stands under tower and Qs, and Ekko only does that with this bad matchups. You'll never see an Ekko try to trade w/ Azir ever. That's just him playing the mid game.

I think that people are cool with the "ebb n flow", but we still have nightmares of what these champs can do when they're too strong. The problem with balancing some of the new kits is that they get out of fucking control in places they weren't intended to go or with items they weren't intended to use. 

Buffing champions like Ekko or Fizz can turn shit sideways and upside down in a hurry, because their kits have a lot of cool shit.

From what I've heard, running AP Quints, glyphs, and using a doran's ring allows for 2 Q casts to clear the wave. I haven't really done this myself, but that's what has been going around.
yeah 1 WAVE? HOW MUCH MANA DOES HE HAE?

Since I'm curious of the math myself, let's see...

Q's cooldown at level 1 is 9 seconds, mana cost is 50. Deals 100 (+90% AP) damage to targets hit by both hits.

He has a mana pool of 280 at level 1. 7 mana per 5 at level 1 as well, so +50% from doran's ring, the assumed starting item. Rounded down that's 2 mana a second.

100 mana - (2*18) - (3 * minions killed, which we assume is 6, so 3*6)

100 - 36 - 18 = total cost being 46 mana over 18 seconds. 

... Damage wise I'm not seeing it, mana wise he'll run out eventually, especially with a Q max.

I'll run this through the practice tool I guess.

EDIT: it does clear the wave with minions clearing, but unless I'm missing something, he misses quite a bit of them. I had ~ 60 mana missing after the second Q.

Ironically I just faced an Ekko yesterday who had me under tower at level 1. The only way I was able to even keep up was to spam my W as Talon in response. I was legit baffled because I had never seen an Ekko do that to me before. We still beat him in the end but early on it was ridiculous. Any champ with very expensive wave clear could never keep up.

It's not fair to just pinpoint a single ability in Ekko's kit. They work in conjunction. We got to look at the whole picture.
Ekko's Q applies two stacks of his passive, which allows him to pick them off with auto attacks.
This makes for mana efficient wave clear, unlike someone like Ryze who has to use multiple abilities to whittle down a wave.
You're right it's not exactly spammable like Cassiopeia's E, but he throws it out as each wave approaches.

Ekko is able to shove out waves quite hard, and will force a few minions to the enemy's turret.
But nearly every mid laner can take out a wave in seconds :(
Not that early, Ekko has similar waveclear to most mages throughout the game, better than quite a few of them in fact.

I feel like Ekko doesn't have as much mana problems as other mid laners. I can't think of many who can spam Q( or whatever wave clear ability) right off the bat every time it's off CD without mana issues.

Now in all fairness, as someone who plays a lot of xerath and has laned many times against Ekko I can tell you this.

Xerath is supposed to have massive waveclear. Same with Ziggs, who I've also played a decent chunk of. Early on, before your mana item, you cannot contend with Ekko's wavecelar with ziggs or xerath. You end up under your turret trying to max range waveclear without letting him jump on you for too much harass. This is a tender and difficult lane for you until you get some mana and levels and can then clear the wave back.

In addition to that, by using your waveclear you are heavily opened up to harass from Ekko if you're not very careful. It's a fairly oppressive lane that gets extremely bad if he gets ahead.

Not a very fun lane.
